summary.long: Colossians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy our brother,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the saints and faithful brethren in Christ, who are at Colossae: Grace be unto you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We give thanks to God and the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, praying always for you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since we heard of your faith in Christ Jesus and of the love which ye have for all the saints,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the hope which is laid up for you in Heaven, of which ye heard before in the word of the truth of the Gospel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which has come unto you, as it has in all the world, and bringeth forth fruit, as it doth also in you since the day ye heard of it and knew the grace of God in truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye also learned of it from Epaphras, our dear fellow servant, who is for you a faithful minister of Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who also declared unto us your love in the Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this cause we also, since the day we heard it, do not cease to pray for you and to desire that ye might be filled with the knowledge of His will in all wisdom and spiritual understanding;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that ye might walk worthy of the Lord, in all pleasing Him, being fruitful in every good work, and increasing in the knowledge of God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: strengthened with all might according to His glorious power, unto all patience and longsuffering with joyfulness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: giving thanks unto the Father, who hath made us meet to be partakers of the inheritance of the saints in light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hath delivered us from the power of darkness, and hath translated us into the Kingdom of His dear Son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in whom we have redemption through His blood, even the forgiveness of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn of every creature.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by Him were all things created that are in heaven and that are on earth, visible and invisible, whether they be thrones or dominions or principalities or powers: all things were created by Him and for Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He is before all things, and by Him all things consist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He is the head of the body, the church. He is the beginning, the firstborn from the dead, that in all things He might have the preeminence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it pleased the Father that in Him should all fullness dwell,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having made peace through the blood of His cross, by Him to reconcile all things unto Himself — by Him, I say, whether they be things on earth or things in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, who were once alienated and enemies in your mind by wicked works, even now hath He reconciled
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the body of His flesh through death, to present you holy and unblamable and unreprovable in His sight,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if ye continue grounded and settled in the faith, and be not moved away from the hope of the Gospel, which ye have heard and which was preached to every creature under heaven, of which I, Paul, am made a minister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I now rejoice in my sufferings for you, and fill up that which is lacking of the afflictions of Christ in my flesh, for His body’s sake, which is the church,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of which I am made a minister according to the dispensation of God, which is given to me for you, to fulfill the Word of God—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even the mystery which hath been hid from ages and from generations, but now is made manifest to His saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To them God would make known what are the riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles, which is Christ in you, the hope of glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Him we preach, warning every man and teaching every man in all wisdom, that we may present every man perfect in Christ Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for which I also labor, striving according to His working, which worketh in me mightily.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I would that ye knew how great is my conflict for you and for those at Laodicea, and for as many as have not seen my face in the flesh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that their hearts might be comforted, being knit together in love unto all the riches of the full assurance of understanding, that they may acknowledge the mystery of God, and of the Father, and of Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in whom are hid all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this I say, lest any man should beguile you with enticing words;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for though I am absent in the flesh, yet am I with you in the spirit, rejoicing and beholding your order and the steadfastness of your faith in Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As ye have therefore received Christ Jesus the Lord, so walk ye in Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: rooted and built up in Him and established in the faith as ye have been taught, abounding therein with thanksgiving.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beware lest any man spoil you through philosophy and vain deceit, following the tradition of men according to the rudiments of the world, and not in accordance with Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in Him dwelleth all the fullness of the Godhead bodily.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye are complete in Him, who is the head of all principality and power,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in whom also ye are circumcised with the circumcision made without hands, in putting off the body of the sins of the flesh by the circumcision of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye are buried with Him in baptism, wherein ye also are risen with Him through the faith wrought by the operation of God, who hath raised Him from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, being dead in your sins and in the uncircumcision of your flesh, hath He quickened together with Him, having forgiven you all trespasses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: blotting out the handwriting of ordinances that was against us, which was contrary to us. He took it out of the way, nailing it to His cross;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having despoiled principalities and powers, He made a show of them openly, triumphing over them in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let no man therefore judge you in meat or drink, or in respect to a holy day or the new moon or the Sabbath days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which are a shadow of things to come, but the body is of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let no man beguile you of your reward by feigned humility and worshiping of angels, intruding into those things which he hath not seen, being vainly puffed up by his fleshly mind,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and not holding to the Head, from whom all the body, having nourishment ministered and knit together by joints and bands, increaseth with the increase from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore if ye be dead with Christ from the rudiments of the world, why, as though living in the world, are ye subject to its ordinances
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (“Touch not, taste not, handle not,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which all are to perish with the using), according to the commandments and doctrines of men?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things have indeed a show of wisdom in willworship and humility and neglecting of the body, but are not in any honor against the satisfying of the flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If ye then be risen with Christ, seek those things which are above, where Christ sitteth at the right hand of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Set your affection on things above, not on things on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye are dead, and your life is hid with Christ in God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Christ, who is our life, shall appear, then shall ye also appear with Him in glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mortify therefore your members which are upon the earth: fornication, uncleanness, inordinate affection, evil concupiscence, and covetousness which is idolatry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of these, the wrath of God cometh on the children of disobedience,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in which ye also once walked, when ye lived in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now ye also put off all these: anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy, filthy communication out of your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not lie one to another, seeing that ye have put off the old man with his deeds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and have put on the new man, which is renewed in knowledge after the image of Him that created him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: where there is neither Greek nor Jew, circumcision nor uncircumcision, barbarian, Scythian, bond nor free, but Christ is all and in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, holy and beloved, as the elect of God, put on hearts of mercies, kindness, humbleness of mind, meekness, longsuffering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: forbearing one another and forgiving one another if any man have a quarrel against another: even as Christ forgave you, so also do ye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And above all these things put on charity, which is the bond of perfectness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let the peace of God rule in your hearts, to which also ye are called in one body, and be ye thankful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly in all wisdom, teaching and admonishing one another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs,singing with grace in your hearts to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whatsoever ye do in word or deed, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father by Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wives, submit yourselves unto your own husbands, as it is fit in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Husbands, love your wives and be not bitter against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Children, obey your parents in all things, for this is well pleasing unto the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fathers, provoke not your children to anger, lest they be discouraged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Servants, obey in all things your masters according to the flesh, not with eyeservice as menpleasers, but in singleness of heart, fearing God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whatsoever ye do, do it heartily, as to the Lord and not unto men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: knowing that from the Lord ye shall receive the reward of the inheritance, for ye serve the Lord Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he that doeth wrong shall receive for the wrong which he hath done, and there is no respect of persons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Masters, give unto your servants that which is just and equitable, knowing that ye also have a Master in Heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Continue in prayer and watch therein with thanksgiving,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: besides praying also for us that God would open unto us a door of utterance to speak the mystery of Christ, for which I am also in bonds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that I may make it manifest, as I ought to speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Walk in wisdom toward those who are outsiders, redeeming the time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let your speech be always with grace, seasoned with salt, that ye may know how ye ought to answer every man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tychicus, who is a beloved brother and a faithful minister and fellow servant in the Lord, shall declare unto you all my circumstances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have sent him unto you for the same purpose, that he might know your state and comfort your hearts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and with him Onesimus, a faithful and beloved brother, who is one of you. They shall make known unto you all things which are done here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aristarchus my fellow prisoner saluteth you, and also Mark, Barnabas’ sister’s son (concerning whom ye received instructions that if he come unto you, receive him),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jesus who is called Justus, who are of the Circumcision. These only are my fellow workers for the Kingdom of God, who have been a comfort unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Epaphras, a servant of Christ who is one of you, saluteth you, always laboring fervently for you in prayers, that ye may stand perfect and complete in all the will of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I bear him record that he hath a great zeal for you and for those who are in Laodicea and those in Hierapolis.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Luke, the beloved physician, and Demas greet you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Salute the brethren who are in Laodicea, and Nymphas and the church which is in his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when this epistle is read among you, cause that it be read also in the church of the Laodiceans, and likewise read the epistle from Laodicea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And say to Archippus, “Take heed to the ministry which thou hast received in the Lord, that thou fulfill it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The salutation by the hand of me, Paul. Remember my bonds. Grace be with you. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
